result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason A Sobbe

defendant.name: Sobbe, Jason A
defendant.address: 25531 West Loomis Road, Wind Lake, WI 53185

records.addlTxt: Defense counsel in Court requesting an adjournment of the 10/27/2022 court date. For reasons discussed off the record, Court grants adjournment. Parties informed of the new date. Case remains calendared in Br 13.

Defendant Jason A Sobbe in court.  Attorney Joel H. Rosenthal in court for Jason A Sobbe.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for deferred prosecution agreement hearing.
Case remains in DPA posture. State informed the Court that restitution was requested and requests additional time to review and draft DPA.
Case is adjourned for Deferred Prosecution Agreement Hearing in Branch 13.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Jason A Sobbe in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jason A Sobbe appeared by video means with Attorney.
Defense counsel informed the Court defendant has a TAD evaluation scheduled 07/28/2022 and requests DPA hearing date.   Court ordered case adjourned for DPA hearing in Branch 37.
All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Jason A Sobbe in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jason A Sobbe appeared by video means with Attorney. Attorney Rosenthal is newly appointed.   Defense counsel to receive discovery and offer and requests additional time to review.  Case may be in a DPA posture.   This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Status conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON (5/18/2022). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with J.M.G. and J.C.G.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jason A Sobbe in court.  Matthew Richard Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 37 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/16/2022@1:00pm
